message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with image processing and computer vision, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) category. The paper specifically addresses the problem of image binarization under significant background variations and observation noise, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) category, as this problem is relevant to document image analysis and OCR. The use of morphological segmentation methods suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.MM (Multimedia) category. The use of robust regression and model selection criteria suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category. Finally, the use of sparse regression suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) category.
